newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks close down on blue chips.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks close down on blue chips.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended down on Wednesday as prices of blue chips fell on profit-taking and dealers said they expected the index to slip further as major investors remained on the sidelines.
The Karachi 100-share index fell 11.25 points, or 0.76 percent, to end at 1,478.75. Losers beat gainers 184 to 117.

"There is no major interest from institutions or genuine investors. Only speculators are active," dealer Sajjad Mankani said. "The index will come down further as political and economic uncertainty persists." PTCL fell 0.30 rupees to 30.70 and Lever Brothers 10 to 640.
